bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Raul de Cardenas, July 12, 1948

div1.p: Hench offers his yellow fever materials for use in a proposed museum.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Raul de Cardenas, July 12, 1948
div1.opener:
July 12, 1948
His Excellency
Raul de Cardenas
Vice President of the Republic of Cuba
Habana, Cuba
Your Excellency:
div1.p:
I greatly appreciate your note of June 23 telling me of the progress
which you and your colleagues are making toward the preservation of the caseta.
I think it will be a wonderful thing when members of the American medical pro-
fession can join with the officials of the Cuban Government and the Cuban medical
profession and honor in this way the outstanding contribution of Doctors Finlay
and Reed and their associates.

I note that you do not believe it is necessary to accept my offer to
pay for the erection of a protective cover. I assume that plans are being made
for its immediate protection and this gives me considerable comfort. I still
hope that there will be ways in which I can assist in this venture. May I again
tell you that I will be only too glad to make available for the little museum
either originals or copies (probably a mixture of both) of many photographs, old
maps, fever charts and other documents connected with the work of Doctor Finlay
and Doctor Reed. Their contribution to the world deserves our continued homage.

The Board of Governors of the Mayo Clinic and other interested physi-
cians here will be indeed glad to hear of your plans for the memorial and I
personally want to express to you again my sincere thanks for your many courtesies
to me. I would appreciate it greatly if you would keep me informed as to further
developments and I would assuredly like to be able to plan to come for the dedi-
cation of the memorial.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
